intro: Sesamum thonneri, commonly known as the African sesame or wild sesame, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Pedaliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain small, oblong seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to poor soil conditions. Sesamum thonneri is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
